alert.note: Alert for Clay; Duval; St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 5:52PM EDT until June 09 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Clay, Duval and St. Johns. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Around 2 inches of rain has already fallen in the Orange Park area. Slow-moving storms heading south into downtown Jacksonville could also cause some ponding on roadways. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Bellair- Meadowbrook Terrace, Nas Jax, Ortega, Lakeside, Doctors Inlet, Fleming Island, Riverside, Normandy, San Marco, Oakleaf Plantation, Switzerland and Jacksonville Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
